data.label:
Player_Romus

“Future leader in training?”

Wiktor Smolak (R)

“I hope you had a good rest, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

“I’d take a whiskey, actually."

Narrator

We took our seats in front of the window with a view just as fantastic as before.

Player_Romus

"Do friends go over to each other's homes, only to become permanent residents, rearranging furniture, dictating house rules, and never leaving?"

Player_Romus

"Is that what we are? Friends?"

Player_Romus

"Just a water, if you will."

Player_Romus

"I hope to have a son of my own someday."

Player_Romus

"How heartwarming. Let's talk about Zille."

Player_Romus

"Interesting. I never took you for a family man."

Player_Romus

"Looks like even presidents have to multitask these days."

Player_Romus

"And who is this little mister?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

“Funny you should mention it…”

Player_Romus

“I seem to remember it being much longer. Dozens of pages longer, in fact."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

“We made an agreement, Your Majesty. I believe we both remember its terms."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

“Yes, we did."

Narrator

Smolak sipped his drink before pulling out a cocktail napkin from his jacket pocket. I saw some vague scribblings on it.

Narrator

He waved his napkin around once more.

Narrator

A brief moment of tension quickly subsided with a flash of the president's trademark smile.

Narrator

His attention returned to his napkin.

Player_Romus

"Please tell me we're not determining the fate of millions via a cocktail napkin."

Player_Romus

"How could I forget?"

Player_Romus

"I honestly couldn't care less. You owe me a conversation about Zille."

Player_Romus

"I'd prefer that we skip over this charade and get to where you tell me you'll hand Zille back to Rizia."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Don't rush me, Your Majesty. You of all people should know about decorum and etiquette."

Player_Romus

"Very well. Then let's discuss trade."

Player_Romus

"Well, if that's the way you wish to proceed, then let's get to the issue of security matters."

Player_Romus

"I assure you, Mr. President, I am well versed in such matters, and don't need a lecturing."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Pending your objection, I'll go ahead and get to the issue of Wehlen-Rizian trade."

Player_Romus

"Hopefully the path ahead is more favorable to your liking."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"My people are very grateful for your generous wine shipments."

Player_Romus

"A deal's a deal."

Player_Romus

"Cantuavo? I thought I recognized it."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I have to say, Your Majesty, I'm not happy with your choices there."

Player_Romus

"My apologies. It couldn't be avoided."

Player_Romus

"Welcome to capitalism, my friend."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Oh, we do. But we tend to reserve those tools for digging graves."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"It's been quite the economic boon."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"It was a joke! That's what it was."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Of course. Now, regarding those issues..."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"If I'm reading my handwriting correctly, it says here..."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Now, as for security related matters..."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Indeed there was."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You reneged on your agreement to ban Bludish citizens from Rizia, granting safe haven to Dast knows how many potential terrorists."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Your refusal to grant the Bludish safe haven in Rizia has helped us catch many a terrorist."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"If I'm reading my handwriting correctly, it says here--"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"In fact, the generous assistance of both Rizia and Sordland has helped us eliminate the Bludish Freedom Front threat altogether!"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I really have to reiterate how disappointed I am that Rizia turned a blind eye to the unrest and turmoil brewing within your neighbor's borders."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"But he is still walking free."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"While your assistance has somewhat hindered their operations, I'm sorry to say that the overall situation remains unchanged since Rizia's involvement."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Regrettably, it appears that our attack on the Bludish Freedom Front has only provoked their ire and bolstered their ranks."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"At this pace, eliminating the terrorist threat will likely require years, if not decades."

Player_Romus

"We have our own priorities to consider. Rizia cannot be expected to intervene in every matter that concerns you."

Player_Romus

"Rizia's stance on this matter is clear. I refuse to repeat myself."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Which doesn't appear to be going away anytime soon."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Thankfully, Wehlen can count on steadfast allies like Sordland, who acknowledge the danger posed by the BFF."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"And, unfortunately, the problem is only getting worse."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"While I'm grateful for your sentiments, unfortunately, it doesn't do anything to change our current situation."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Maybe not now, but, nevertheless, I suggest keeping an open mind."

Player_Romus

"As pleased as I am to hear it, we must remain cautious. Crushing a movement is one thing, but killing an idea is another."

Player_Romus

"He's been deposed. That should still serve the same purpose."

Player_Romus

"Because the more I deliberated on it, the more I realized that the political fallout from arresting my cousin would be too great. It's as simple as that."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Needless to say, it was quite distressing to hear that particular piece of news."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Yes, well apparently, Wehlen doesn't fall under what you consider 'political fallout.'"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Invoking 'inability to act' is a sign of weakness. I do hope that moving forward, you'll find more *effective* ways to address such challenges."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Don't confuse punishment with justice. They aren't interchangeable."

Player_Romus

"As he should be. He might be flawed, but incarcerating him won't make your problems go away."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"And for that, you have my respect."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I'll leave redemption to God, but don't expect any divine intervention to fix his mess."

Player_Romus

"Indeed. It was about time that dog was placed in his kennel."

Narrator

Smolak finished his drink very slowly.

Player_Romus

"Any more napkins in there that I should know about?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Leave us? Well, the way I see it--"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Your Majesty... may I present, Zille."

Player_Romus

"I must say, you've outdone yourself this time, Smolak. The view is absolutely stunning."

Narrator

Smolak returned his gaze to the view before us as a momentary silence fell between us.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I must say... the sight of Zille takes my breath away every time I see it..."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Which is why I will very much miss seeing the Wehlen flag flying proudly over its expanse."

Player_Romus

"Wait, you're saying you're giving up control over Zille?"

Player_Romus

"Back up a minute. What are you saying?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"And you have my most sincere respect and deepest admiration."

Player_Romus

"I knew it."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"What Wehlen and Rizia have goes beyond friendship... it's a bond that cannot be broken."

Narrator

We spent the remainder of our weekend traversing the skies aboard Smolak's airship, immersing ourselves in Wehlen's stunning vistas.

Narrator

Amidst exchanging stories and reveling in each other's company, the weight of our successful diplomatic negotiations for Zille's return gradually became apparent.

Player_Romus

"Well, go on. Let's hear it."

Player_Romus

"Tell me what you want. I'm sure we can address the issue."

Player_Romus

"Oh, that is such bullshit! After everything I've done to meet your 'conditions,' you honestly expect me to comply with yet another demand?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"That's why, as a final gesture of goodwill and to solidify our agreement, I request ownership of your mother's childhood home, seeing as how she grew up there and all."

Player_Romus

"That house holds great sentimental value to both my mother and myself."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"But given everything we've just discussed, I'm afraid I simply can't part with it. It holds too much... sentimental value."

Player_Romus

"I'm honestly shocked to hear this. Is there anything Rizia can do to change your mind?"

Player_Romus

"Oh, please... Stop beating around the bush and tell me what you want."

Player_Romus

"So you brought me all the way out here just to tell me no?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"What I want is for you to take a breath, and read between the lines of what I'm trying to imply. That being..."

Narrator

Smolak reached into his pants pocket and retrieved another cocktail napkin with writing on it. He held it out to me.

Player_Romus

"So it seems."

Narrator

I took the napkin and read over his conditions.

Narrator

I took the napkin from him and read over his conditions.

Player_Romus

"Well, I do hope you're just as prepared for the potential ramifications should these negotiations not reach a satisfactory conclusion."

Player_Romus

"It just says "referendum" over and over again. What is this?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"The way I see it, it should be up to the people of Zille to decide. Who are we to dictate their destiny without consent?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I believe the decision of reunification should be up to the people of Zille to decide. Who are we to dictate their destiny without consent?"

Player_Romus

"Implementing such an inherently flawed democratic process risks sowing seeds of instability throughout the region."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I disagree wholeheartedly. A decision of this magnitude that goes against the will of the people will merely breed resentment and dissent. They must have a choice in the matter."

Player_Romus

"It's funny how someone masquerading in a suit and tie could, in fact be a walking, talking embodiment of duplicity and deception. If you think I'd ever agree to such a proposal, you're greatly mistaken."

Player_Romus

"Allowing the people of Zille to decide their fate independently could lead to destabilization within the region."

Player_Romus

"I must say, of all people, I'm rather surprised to hear you advocating for democratic principles. Nevertheless, for once, you and I see eye to eye. Leave it to the people to decide."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Right. I forgot I was speaking to a Malenyevisit. In any case..."

Player_Romus

"Coming from someone who governs with an iron fist, I find your concern for democratic principles utterly fascinating."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"The way I see it, a decision of this magnitude that goes against the will of the people will merely breed resentment and dissent. They must have a choice in the matter."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Otherwise, I fear that decision of this magnitude made by us that goes against the will of the people will merely breed resentment and dissent. Having a choice in the matter is crucial."

Player_Romus

"Alright. I'm convinced. A referendum it is. We'll let the people of Zille have their say and settle this matter once and for all."

Player_Romus

"Very well, if you insist. Let the people of Zille have their say. But my faith tells me that they will make the right decision."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I presented you an opportunity that was more than fair, but if you're unwilling to compromise, then there's no point in continuing this discussion."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Come now, Your Majesty, there's no need to look so despairing."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I will present my case for a referendum on Zille to the Alliance of Nations. Some of our compatriots still have respect for the democratic process, you see."

Player_Romus

"The fate of Zille isn't solely in your hands. Wehlen's decision to delay only prolongs the inevitable, and I'm prepared to pursue other avenues to achieve our objectives. Consider this your one and final warning."

Narrator

We passed the rest of our weekend soaring through the skies on Smolak's airship, taking in the sights of Wehlen and the distant horizon of Zille.

Narrator

As I endured Smolak's company, the gravity of our diplomatic negotiations for Zille's return slowly became evident.

Player_Romus

"The fate of Zille isn't solely yours to decide. Wehlen's delay only prolongs what's destined. I'm prepared to seek divine guidance to achieve our goals."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Well, this certainly sets the stage for an uncomfortable return journey. I'll take my leave so that you may reflect upon the implications of your decisions."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Well, then I suppose we're not the friends I thought we were, which will certainly make for an uncomfortable return journey."

Player_Romus

"I see you're still pushing for oil exports."

Player_Romus

"You want us to export Rizian gold. No surprise there."

Player_Romus

"Looks like you're still keen on beefing up your military arsenal."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Nor should it. Having gold as Wehlen's backup currency naturally adds to our financial stability, boosts confidence in our currency, and provides a sensible approach to managing risks in our monetary system."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"No need to get defensive. I'm simply stating facts."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Not to mention, our 'special military operation' against the BFF. If they're to be defeated, we need the means to do so."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Not to mention, the ever-present threat of Bludish provocators within my country's borders, ready to reemerge at any moment and overthrow the government."

Player_Romus

"Understandable. We live in uncertain times, after all."

Player_Romus

"If the situation is as bad as you say it is, then maybe a change is in order."

Player_Romus

"Come now, surely you're capable of facing any and all adversity head-on without the need for Rizian hardware."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Only if we're given the proper tools to make that happen."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I expect you to do what in Rizia's best interest, naturally."

Player_Romus

"If it's oil imports you want, I'll make it happen. Even if it means taking a hit in the short term."

Player_Romus

"Venturing into this would be financial suicide, and our energy sector can't afford to take that hit. We will not be extorted!"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Excellent! Your willingness to adapt to the situation is commendable, Your Majesty."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"That's unfortunate. Well, if there's no changing your mind, then perhaps you'll agree to another."

Player_Romus

"Regarding gold..."

Player_Romus

"As for receiving military supplies..."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I'm quite disappointed by your unwillingness to compromise. In that case, I'm afraid that I have no choice but hold a referendum in Zille regarding the issue of reunification."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Fantastic! I appreciate your willingness to compromise."

Player_Romus

"I'm sorry, but the financial and energy commitments involved pose too great a risk for us to proceed at this time."

Player_Romus

"Dig up your own gold if you're so desperate for it. Rizia's resources aren't here to bail out every financial whim of Wehlen."

Player_Romus

"If we're turning to ancient remedies, maybe we should consider sacrificing a few goats and dancing naked under the full moon as well."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I'm pleased to hear it. I knew we could work something out."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"That's unfortunate to hear. Nonetheless, if you're adamant about your position, perhaps we could explore an alternative solution?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Great! See? That wasn't so hard."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"So... is that a yes or no?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Great! Just make sure your mountain of gold doesn't crumble under the weight of my expectations."

Player_Romus

"I'm willing to agree to your terms under the condition that you promise to use these supplies for morally justifiable reasons."

Player_Romus

"I can agree to that, provided it doesn't entangle us directly in any of conflict you're currently waging."

Player_Romus

"I'm willing to send a substantial shipment, but only under the condition that you vow to utilize these supplies solely for just causes, in accordance with the teachings of our holy scriptures."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"How about I promise to use them for morally ambiguous reasons? It's more fun that way."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"But in all seriousness, I'm pleased to hear it. There's nothing more justifiably moral than defending one's land, and the people you love."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Your unwillingness to seek common ground is disappointing. Therefore, I feel compelled to begin the process of holding a referendum in Zille to address the issue of reunification."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Think of it as a friendly suggestion."

Player_Romus

"Alright. You want to negotiate? I'll negotiate."

Player_Romus

"Then my answer is no. What you've asked of me will only hurt Rizia in the longrun."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"But if you're not willing to discuss further..."

Player_Romus

"Please... as if any referendum run by you wouldn't have the outcome predetermined ahead of time."

Player_Romus

"Oh, this?"

Player_Romus_Italic

I torn the napkin in half, letting it float to the floor.

Player_Romus_Italic

I handed the napkin back to Smolak.

Player_Romus

"It's best if you keep it."

Player_Romus

"Be sure to toss it in the trash on your way out."

Narrator

Smolak didn't so much as flinch.

Narrator

Smolak stayed resolute, showing no reaction.

Player_Romus

"Alright. You want to negotiate? I'll negotiate. But I'm only willing to make one concession."

Narrator

A quiet moment settled between us. Smolak, once more, directed his gaze towards our vantage point of Zille. He appeared unusually solemn.

Player_Romus

"Tell me more about this referendum you keep referring to."

Player_Romus

"What game are you playing at? This is starting to sound like another last minute condition."

Player_Romus

"Why do I get the feeling the ball is about to drop?"

Player_Romus

"Actually, I've played along with you enough. I refuse to make any more concessions."

Player_Romus

"So you really have no intention of fulfilling the terms of our agreement."

Player_Romus

"Your wit is as sharp as a spoon."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Oh, and in case I didn't make myself clear..."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You see, over these last few years I've I've become quite found of Zille. And believe me, I was just as surprised as you might be to hear it."

Player_Romus

"I'd say you were bluffing, but I honestly believe you might be a walking, talking piece of shit."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Ha! That wasn't the answer I was looking for, but it's the answer I'll accept. Forget about the request. Let's celebrate to new beginning!"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Really? I'm honestly surprised you'd agree to such terms. But hey, if you're so eager to pawn off your family history, who am I to refuse?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Come, we have much to celebrate!"

Narrator

Smolak shook his head.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I must say... the sight of Zille takes my breath away every time I see it... As I hope it does for you too."

Player_Romus

"Not give it back? Like hell, you won't!"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Look, I wish I could help you. I really do. But a deal's a deal. I have a reputation to uphold."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"From here on out..."

Narrator

Taken aback, I paused for a moment to process what I'd just heard.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Come now, Your Majesty. Empty threats are beneath someone of your stature."

Player_Romus

"Empty threats? You underestimate me, Smolak."

Player_Romus

"The only one here beneath my stature is you."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You've got a lot of moxie, King. But that blind self-confidence will only get you so far."

Narrator

My eyes remained locked on an enormous airship moored at a blimp base on the outskirts of the Presidential Palace in Wraclawitz, Wehlen's capital. Its sleek form dominated the skyline.

Narrator

“With Smolak at the Helm: Wehlen Soars to New Heights!"

Narrator

Our agreement's three-year probationary period had come to an end. It was finally time to discuss the return of Zille. However, my host was nowhere in sight.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"This would be my son, Wiktor Smolak II. After eleven daughters, courtesy of my eight wives -- all of whom I’m still married to -- I finally have a boy!"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"It's never too late, Your Majesty! Not for men like us."

Player_Romus

"Well, shall we get to it then?"

Player_Romus

"Looks like that's our cue to get this meeting started."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"On the contrary, I'd say this is the perfect time to sightsee. We've got a long flight ahead of us, which will give us plenty of time to talk."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"What's the rush? We've got plenty of time to talk. We've got a long flight ahead of us."

Narrator

Several hours later, I woke up to the site of a vast expanse of ocean appearing over the horizon. I had fallen asleep in one of the lounge chairs on the observation deck.

Narrator

I turned to see Smolak standing over me. Little Wiktor was in his arms.

Player_Romus

"A coffee, please."

Player_Romus

"Thanks, but I'm good."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Right away. Come with me."

Player_Romus

"A wine sounds nice."

Player_Romus

"Whatever you're having."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Great choice. We shall drink and converse like men."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I confess I'm not much of a drinker, Your Majesty. Unless it's to butter up a potential trade partner. Shall we?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Patience is a virtue, Your Majesty. We haven't even taken off yet."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I get that a lot."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Hey, take a step back. Relax and enjoy the ride! We've got a long flight ahead of us. They'll be time for all of that soon enough."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You're the first world leader to share a ride on my airship."

Player_Romus

"I'm honored."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You should be. Everyone else is so official and by the book."

Player_Romus

"Why am I not surprised?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I'd like to think so. Our two nations have been there for each other in the past. I see no reason why we can't continue that partnership now and in the years to come."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Ah, I see what you did there. Someone wants to get right to talking about Zille."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Which is why we're here, so let's get into it."

Narrator

Smolak sipped his drink before pulling out a cocktail napkin from his jacket pocket. I could see some vague scribblings on it.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"If you remember, we signed an agreement regarding the conditions for Zille return to Rizia."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Oh, I never remember anything I sign. In fact, I'm going to fill you in on a little secret..."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I beg your pardon. I'll try to use a chalkboard next time."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"As you can see, I made a few notes ahead of time. Though it's a bit hard to read. Helps me be direct and to the point."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Well, I for one define a friend as someone you can trust to be completely honest with you. Even -- especially -- if you've done something wrong."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"It was if Rizia didn't respect Wehlen or her wishes at all. I left questioning whether or not Rizia could be trusted to uphold agreements or negotiate in good faith in general."

Player_Romus

"We do respect you. I'm here, aren't I?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Just because you're here doesn't make you a trusted ally. Those sorts of relationships take time."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"The sight of Zille takes my breath away every time I see it..."

Narrator

Smolak shot me a dirty look.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Yes, it would seem so."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You also promised to provide us with military equipment. However, we're getting hardly any at all. I hear your stockpiles are running low?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You also promised to provide us with military equipment, which you've followed through on."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Given all of our ongoing conflicts... the more guns, the better."

Narrator

Several hours later, after falling asleep on one of the lounge chairs on the observation deck, I was suddenly startled awake by the sharp slap of a newspaper hitting the side table beside me.

Narrator

It was a copy of the Royal Herald, the top story being the revelation about Lespia’s involvement in the Friendship Day bombing.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"So this really is true then, eh, Your Majesty?"

Player_Romus

"Every word of it. We have the evidence to prove its authenticity."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"That's reassuring."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Ha! Yes. A sentiment I share as well."

Player_Romus

"We don't know the details yet. Ricardus may have been working in concert with Alvarez's government."

Player_Romus

"You are the one who wanted my cousin out of power. You didn't care whether he was innocent or not, so why should I?"

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Interesting, Your Majesty. Very interesting."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"It should be evident without explanation how crucial it is for Wehlen to support our currency."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Just look at that. It's amazing what we can accomplish when our two nations work together."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"In honor of everything we've accomplished, I wanted to give you this small token of gratitude."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"A beautiful doorstopper, intricately carved by our most skilled of artisans."

Narrator

I couldn't help but notice the item's unique shape.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I had a feeling you would like it, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"I'm honored. It is proof that neither of us have been saddled with a bum deal."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Oh! But first..."

Narrator

Smolak opened a cabinet and took out an attaché case.

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"There's just one thing I'm confused about."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"What an interesting approach to justice you have! And the rest of your family shares that outlook, I presume."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Would you care for a drink? We've got everything."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Our meeting three years ago didn't exactly fill me with confidence about Zille's security."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I was very happy with how you and your security forces handled the Friendship Day bombing investigation."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"The amount of military strength you've managed to amass since your reign began is truly impressive."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Even if you're currently wasting it on a losing war with Pales."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"It troubles me that you still haven't come to your senses regarding your one-sided relationship with Rumburg."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Derdians remain banned from entry into your kingdom. Very nice."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"I want to thank you profusely for your country's cooperation in our Operation Bear Trap."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"But that is not your fault, Your Majesty."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Your withdrawal from our Operation Bear Trap was a betrayal of the highest order."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You, on the other hand.... you dare to hire the Bluds as mercenaries? That will surely backfire on you in the end, Your Majesty."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"You promised me that Duke Ricardus Toras would answer for his crimes."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"When can I expect his transfer to Wehlen?"

Player_Romus

"He's staying in Rizia. I want to see his face when he gets the guillotine."

Wiktor Smolak (R)

"Not to mention that you made him Chief of Police in your capital! That doesn't count as teaching him a lesson."
